comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: JOSHUA CRANE BEATS PENNELL AT TENNIS; American Qualifies to Play Jay Gould for American Title at Racquet Club. April 12, 1912, Friday Page 11, 968 words Jay Gould, the American champion court tennis player, refereed the match in the final round of the series arranged to provide an opponent for him in the challenge match for the American title scheduled for to-morrow, and witnessed the triumph of an American. Joshua Crane of Boston, over Vane Pennell of England, by a score of three sets to two, after a series of games which bristled with keen play. Here is article about him from Wikipedia (note spelling of his first name is Vane): en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vane_Pennell
